content.description: The boxplot shown summarizes the <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> highest salaries for municipal employees in a large city.
content.question: A new municipal employee was hired and was told that the salary would be within the middle <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the current <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> highest salaries. Based on the boxplot, which of the following is closest to the width of the interval in which the new employeeâ€™s salary will fall?

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
